table.name: Beneficial Manifestations
table.caption: Beneficial Manifestations
rows: Your creation has a smell that is pleasing to you, even if there is no source for it.
You can spend 1 minute to dispel any lightly obscuring conditions within 120 feet in your creation.
Within your creation, you can cast create food and water once per day without using a spell slot.
You can understand any language spoken within 30 feet of you while within your creation.
Beasts find your creation appealing or off-putting (you decide).
When your creation is made, you decide what weather is possible within it.
You cannot be charmed or frightened while within your creation.
All structures in your creation have +2 AC.
You have advantage on your passive Perception score within your creation.

table.name: Damage Types
rows: Acid
The corrosive spray of a black dragon's breath and the dissolving enzymes secreted by a black pudding deal acid damage.
Bludgeoning
Blunt force attacks—hammers, falling, constriction, and the like—deal bludgeoning damage.
Cold
The infernal chill radiating from an ice devil's spear and the frigid blast of a white dragon's breath deal cold damage.
Fire
Red dragons breathe fire, and many spells conjure flames to deal fire damage.
Force
Force is pure magical energy focused into a damaging form. Most effects that deal force damage are spells, including magic missile and spiritual weapon.
Lightning
A lightning bolt spell and a blue dragon's breath deal lightning damage.
Necrotic
Necrotic damage, dealt by certain undead and some spells, withers matter and even the soul.
Piercing
Puncturing and impaling attacks, including spears and monsters' bites, deal piercing damage.
Poison
Venomous stings and the toxic gas of a green dragon's breath deal poison damage.
Psychic
Mental abilities such as a mind flayer's psionic blast deal psychic damage.
Radiant
Radiant damage, dealt by a cleric's flame strike spell or an angel's smiting weapon, sears the flesh like fire and overloads the spirit with power.
Slashing
Swords, axes, and monsters' claws deal slashing damage.
Thunder
A concussive burst of sound, such as the effect of the thunderwave spell, deals thunder damage.

table.name: Derro Madness
table.caption: Derro Madness
rows: Never bathes or changes clothes
Frets with hair or mustache
Speaks to someone who isn't there
Walks backward whenever possible
Never looks others in the eye
Gnashes teeth after each sentence
Spits out half of each mouthful of food and drink
Insults everyone when first addressing them
Touches whomever he or she speaks to
Sees the spirits of the dead leaving their bodies
Faints when first subjected to bright light
Frequently licks their palms
Hears voices
Terrified of writing
Tastes objects
Stands too close to others
Breathes loudly
Drools constantly
Mumbles when speaking
Hops from place to place

table.name: Detrimental Manifestations
table.caption: Detrimental Manifestations
rows: Your creation has an unpleasant smell, even if there is no source for it.
Your creation is prone to haze, fog, and other lightly obscured conditions.
Your creation has uncommonly long days or nights (DM decides).
Structures in your creation only have arrow loops instead of windows.
Beasts either infest or avoid your creation (DM decides).
Strange weather patterns occur in your creation (DM decides what and when).
All DCs to detect or track creatures in your creation increase by 2.
All structures in your creation have −2 AC.
You have disadvantage on your passive Perception score within your creation.

entries.name: 坟墓的召唤
entries: 死亡天使对你转瞬即逝的灵魂念念不忘，希望你回来。当你在战斗开始时掷出主动权时，进行一次死亡救赎（%0%）。如果你的救赎失败，游戏管理者会选择一个亡灵生物，其CR等于或低于你的等级。它出现在距离你 36 米远的地方，并加入对你的战斗。该生物随时都能知道你的位置，并毫不犹豫地追击你。当你的命中率降至 0、死亡或 10 分钟后，它就会消失。

entries.name: 来自远方的记忆
entries: 死亡的记忆挥之不去。在每次{@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|长休}结束时，描述你的角色是如何试图忘记死亡的感觉，然后根据你的答案做出一个智慧{@quickref saving throws|PHB|2|1|蓄力一击}，DC由GM设定。如果救赎失败，你将获得一级 {@condition exhaustion} 持续时间，直到你受到 {@spell greater restoration} 或类似魔法的伤害，或者直到你花了 30 天时间专注于停机来与你的记忆和解。

entries.name: 目的不明
entries: 一种更强大的力量出于某种原因允许你回来。这可能是一个神，比如你现在可以与之交流的（%0%），或者是一个不起眼的超自然生物。这个结果可能是成为这个神的（%1%）或（%2%）的机会，也可能是提升（%3%）等级的机会。或者，如果你选择不与这个实体立约，或者你不服从他们的要求，就在这张表格上再掷一次。你将承受新的后果，直到你遵守该实体的宗旨或找到摆脱他们关注的方法。

entries.name: 顽固的伤口
entries: 每当你失败一次死亡 {@quickref saving throws|PHB|2|1|蓄力一击}，你的命中率上限就会减少 {@dice 2d10}，直到你完成一次死亡 {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|长休}。如果你的命中率上限以这种方式降为 0，你就会死亡。

entries.name: 秘密面孔
entries: 你不再是你自己，而是一个取代了你的位置的混乱邪恶变形者。你扮演这个替身，并使用你原来的游戏数据，直到替身被杀死或这个后果被克服为止。由游戏管理者决定你的灵魂究竟被囚禁在哪里--可能是你本该去的来世，也可能是你的替身的邪恶领域。

entries.name: 对死亡的渴望
entries: 每天一次，你或通用必须决定使用以下反应： 当你看到一个你认为有敌意或可能有敌意的生物，并且你与该生物的距离等于或小于你的速度时，你会立即积极地将你的速度移向该生物，然后对其发动一次近战攻击。如果你的攻击出乎意料，你的攻击掷中率为 {@quickref Advantage and Disadvantage|PHB|2|0|好处}。

entries.name: 不透明的思想
entries: 你痴迷地回想着生命将你从死亡之口撕裂的感觉。这些无处不在的记忆充斥着你的大脑，使你对任何能感知你的情绪或读取你的思想的效果免疫。同样，其他生物在进行智慧（{@skill Insight}）检查以确定你的意图时，也会受到 {@quickref Advantage and Disadvantage|PHB|2|0|弱势} 的影响。

entries.name: 非凡的意识
entries: 你的磨难在你的灵魂上留下了印记，现在你的灵魂会在亡灵面前颤抖。只要有亡灵生物出现在你 9 米范围内，你就会知道，而且在此范围内攻击（%1%）亡灵时，你不会受到（%0%）影响。然而，这种持续的感知会让你分心，当任何亡灵生物在你 9 米范围内时，你的智力（（%3%））和智慧（（%4%））检定会受到（%2%）的影响。

entries.name: 复仇的纽带
entries: 你作为复仇者归来，对杀死你的生物怀有永不熄灭的仇恨火花。作为一个行动，你可以专注于这个火花，立即了解到任何杀死你的生物的距离和方向。如果该生物位于不同的位面，你只能得知该信息。如果杀死你的生物死亡，你会立即知道。如果你与杀死你的生物距离在 36 米以内，你对任何其他生物的攻击卷轴都有（%0%）的加成。

entries.name: 永远不再
entries: 当命中率降至 0 时，你不会昏迷。相反，你会一直保持清醒，直到你的回合结束，并且没有攻击生物或施放 1 级或更高的法术。当你的命中点数为 0 时，你的攻击卷轴会有 {@quickref Advantage and Disadvantage|PHB|2|0|好处} 的命中率，你的攻击会在命中时造成额外 {@damage 1d10} 的伤害，对你的攻击卷轴会有 {@quickref Advantage and Disadvantage|PHB|2|0|弱势} 的命中率。你会像正常人一样死亡（%3%），包括在受到伤害时失败。此外，每当你的命中点数为 0 时受到伤害，你的命中点数上限就会减少与伤害等量的数值，直到你完成 {@quickref resting|PHB|2|0|长休} 的攻击。

table.name: Major Adaptations
table.caption: Major Adaptations
rows: Acidic Skin. Any creature that touches the krasis or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 2 (1d4) acid damage (category 1), 4 (1d8) acid damage (category 2), or 6 (1d12) acid damage (category 3).
Armored Hide. The krasis has better natural armor afforded by a shell or thick scales, increasing its Armor Class by 4.
Bioluminescent Markings. The krasis has glowing patterns on its skin that take the shape of defensive runes, granting it advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
Flight. The krasis has wings and gains a flying speed equal to its walking speed.

Grabber. When the krasis hits a creature with its claws, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape DC 13 for category 1, DC 15 for category 2, and DC 19 for category 3) by a specialized grasping appendage on the krasis. It can have only one creature {@condition grappled} in this way at a time.

Hypnotic Display {@recharge 5}. As an action, the krasis creates mesmerizing colors and shapes around itself. Each creature within 15 feet of it that can see it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC 12 for category 1, DC 14 for category 2, and DC 18 for category 3) or be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. The {@condition stunned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that succeeds on a saving throw against this effect becomes immune to the Hypnotic Display of all krasis for 24 hours.

Venomous Sting. When the krasis hits a creature with its claws, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 12 for category 1, DC 14 for category 2, and DC 18 for category 3) or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. If the krasis is a category 2 or 3, the creature is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned} in this way. The {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Regeneration. The krasis regains hit points (2 for a category 1, 5 for a category 2, and 10 for a category 3) at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 hit point.

table.name: Minor Adaptations
table.caption: Minor Adaptations
rows: Amorphous Structure. The krasis can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.
Aquatic. The krasis gains a swimming speed equal to its walking speed.
Climbing Speed. The krasis gains a climbing speed equal to its walking speed.
Cryptic Skin. The krasis can change color to match its surroundings. It has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide.

Heightened Awareness. The krasis can't be {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised}, as a result of having sensitive barbels like a catfish, stereoscopic vision like a chameleon, a tongue like a snake, eye stalks like a lobster, or an array of several eyes.

Ink Cloud (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest). While underwater, the krasis can use a bonus action to expel a cloud of ink and then move up to its speed. The ink cloud is stationary and fills a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point in the krasis's space before it moves. The sphere is heavily obscured until the ink disperses after 1 minute. A strong current also disperses the ink cloud.

Leaping Legs. With or without a running start, the krasis's long jump is 20 feet (category 1), 30 feet (category 2), or 40 feet (category 3). Its high jump is 10 feet (category 1), 20 feet (category 2), or 30 feet (category 3).
Stabilizing Legs. The krasis has several crablike legs. As a result, it has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}.

table.name: Whirlpools; Whirlpool Rank
table.caption: Whirlpool Rank
rows: 5 ft.
15 ft.
25 ft.
35 ft.

table.name: Who Created It or Was Intended to Use It?
table.caption: Who Created It or Was Intended to Use It?
rows: {@bold Sun Empire}. The item was created during the heyday of the Sun Empire, most likely during the time that the Immortal Sun was housed in the imperial capital of Orazca. It might be tied to a former emperor or an emperor's champion. It might be decorated with imagery of the Immortal Sun, as well as geometric patterns, feather designs, or dinosaur shapes. It might be made of silver or incorporate amber.
{@bold Dinosaur}. This item is made from scales, teeth, talons, or feathers shed by a dinosaur.

{@bold River Heralds}. The item is probably crafted from jade or polished wood. It might include designs resembling knots or braids. If fabric, it appears to be knotted or braided out of long strips. Weapons often have a wave-like curve to their design. The item could have an elemental spirit bound into it.

{@bold Brazen Coalition}. The item was devised by the crafty inventors of the Brazen Coalition. It might incorporate designs like ship fittings or knotted rope into its construction, or it could feature polished wood, carefully focused lenses, or fabric that billows like sails.
{@bold Legion of Dusk}. The item might be fashioned of bone, gold, or ancient-looking black wood. It might have a two-pronged motif or incorporate the rose-like symbol of the Legion.
{@bold Coatl}. The item is half the weight of other items of its kind, and is inscribed with feathered wings, serpents, suns, and other symbols of good. Demons find the item's presence repulsive.

{@bold Demonic}. The item is made of black iron or horn inscribed with runes, and any cloth or leather components are crafted from the hide of demons. It might incorporate the feathers, claws, or beaks of harpies. It is warm to the touch and features leering faces or vile runes engraved on its surface. Coatls find the item's presence repulsive.

{@bold Dryad}. The item is exquisitely crafted from wood, leaves, or vines. It is adorned with symbols of nature: leaves, vines, stars, and the like. It glows with a pale radiance in moonlight, shedding dim light in a 5-foot radius.
